1.text: Better is a dry morsel and quietness therewith, Than a house full of feasting with strife.

2.text: A servant that dealeth wisely shall have rule over a son that dealeth shamefully, And shall have part of the inheritance among the brethren.

3.text: The refining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold; But the LORD trieth the hearts.

4.text: A evil-doer giveth heed to wicked lips; And a liar giveth ear to a mischievous tongue.

5.text: Whoso mocketh the poor blasphemeth his Maker; And he that is glad at calamity shall not be unpunished.

6.text: Childrenâ€™s children are the crown of old men; And the glory of children are their fathers.

7.text: Overbearing speech becometh not a churl; Much less do lying lips a prince.

8.text: A gift is as a precious stone in the eyes of him that hath it; Whithersoever he turneth, he prospereth.

9.text: He that covereth a transgression seeketh love; But he that harpeth on a matter estrangeth a familiar friend.

10.text: A rebuke entereth deeper into a man of understanding Than a hundred stripes into a fool.

11.text: A rebellious man seeketh only evil; Therefore a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.

12.text: Let a bear robbed of her whelps meet a man, Rather than a fool in his folly.

13.text: Whoso rewardeth evil for good, Evil shall not depart from his house.

14.text: The beginning of strife is as when one letteth out water; Therefore leave off contention, before the quarrel break out.

15.text: He that justifieth the wicked, and he that condemneth the righteous, Even they both are an abomination to the LORD.

16.text: Wherefore is there a price in the hand of a fool To buy wisdom, seeing he hath no understanding?

17.text: A friend loveth at all times, And a brother is born for adversity.

18.text: A man void of understanding is he that striketh hands, And becometh surety in the presence of his neighbour.

19.text: He loveth transgression that loveth strife; He that exalteth his gate seeketh destruction.

20.text: He that hath a froward heart findeth no good; And he that hath a perverse tongue falleth into evil.

21.text: He that begetteth a fool doeth it to his sorrow; And the father of a churl hath no joy.

22.text: A merry heart is a good medicine; But a broken spirit drieth the bones.

23.text: A wicked man taketh a gift out of the bosom, To pervert the ways of justice.

24.text: Wisdom is before him that hath understanding; But the eyes of a fool are in the ends of the earth.

25.text: A foolish son is vexation to his father, And bitterness to her that bore him.

26.text: To punish also the righteous is not good, Nor to strike the noble for their uprightness.

27.text: He that spareth his words hath knowledge; And he that husbandeth his spirit is a man of discernment.

28.text: Even a fool, when he holdeth his peace, is counted wise; And he that shutteth his lips is esteemed as a man of understanding.
